DOC.detailed_description: Background : Bi- , tri- multi- focal ( 'multifocal ' ) glass associate increased rate fall old people ( Lord et al 2002 ) . Study Aim : To determine whether provision supplementary plain distance glass outdoor use old user multifocal glass reduce fall rate 12 month period . Study Design : A randomised control assessor-blinded trial two parallel group 580 participant . Study inclusion criterion : outdoor use multifocal glass 3 time per week , community-dwelling person age 65+ year recent fall OR person age 80+ year regardless fall history , Folstein Mini Mental score 24+ , adequate visual contrast sensitivity ( Melbourne Edge Test score 16+dB ) . All participant receive optometry assessment update multifocal glass ( require ) baseline . Intervention group subject receive pair plain distance glass counsel use predominantly outdoor situation . Control group participant use multifocal glass usual manner . Falls rate compliance intervention record monthly fall diary return participant .
